description: Adobe Illustrator Creative Cloud is used by both artists and graphic designers to create vector images both in print and digital form. It is typically used to create illustrations, charts, graphs, logos, diagrams, cartoons of real photographs. This course covers exam objectives for the Adobe Certified Associate (ACA) certification.
descriptionMD: Adobe Illustrator Creative Cloud is used by both artists and graphic designers to create vector images both in print and digital form. It is typically used to create illustrations, charts, graphs, logos, diagrams, cartoons of real photographs. This course covers exam objectives for the Adobe Certified Associate (ACA) certification.
name: Illustrator CC 2017
subtitle: Graphics Design Application

episodes.description: Emily and Vonne introduce Adobe Illustrator CC 2017. They discuss the uses of Illustrator, explain raster and vector information, and review differences of Illustrator on a Mac and Windows operating systems.
episodes.title: Introduction to Illustrator

episodes.description: Every designer should understand the foundations of digital design - file types, resolution, and color modes.  In this episode, Emily and Vonne give an introduction to these web and graphic design core concepts.
episodes.title: Design 101

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily review the Illustrator workspace. They demonstrate how to work with the panels, toolbox, control panel (also know as the options bar) , and preset workspaces.  They also show how to create custom workspaces as well as zooming techniques and shortcuts.
episodes.title: Navigating in Illustrator

episodes.description: In this episode, Emily and Vonne demonstrate how to create a new file In Illustrator.  They review file presets, measurement units, artboards, and advanced options. They also explain the importance of saving a file in its native version of Illustrator.
episodes.title: File New

episodes.description: Selecting elements in an Illustrator file is key.  In this episode, Vonne and Emily demonstrate how to select multiple objects and understand the meaning of the colors shown on the screen. They also review the layers panel and selection shortcuts.
episodes.title: Basic Selections

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily show how to make basic shapes. They review the different tools to make open and closed paths as well as basic formatting.  They also review the meaning and importance the selection and the direct selection tools.
episodes.title: Basic Shapes and Formatting

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily continue with shapes showing the star, line, arc, spiral, rectangular grid, and polar grid tools. They show some handy shortcuts to use with these tools as well as new ways to close paths with the line tool.
episodes.title: Basic Shapes and Formatting Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Emily and Vonne review basic text. They discuss the difference between area type and point type and how easy it is now to convert using the selection tool.  They demonstrate basic character and paragraph formatting and how to use the type panels
episodes.title: Basic Text

episodes.description: Color is fun! In this episode, Vonne and Emily demonstrate how to create swatches using the swatches panel, the color and color guide panels, the swatches libraries, and the color themes panel.
episodes.title: Swatches

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily work with multiple paths.  They show different ways to select multiple paths, grouping and ungrouping objects, and shortcuts for duplicating objects. They also dive into the layers panel, showing how to arrange object stacking order, rename layers, show/hide layers, and selecting objects from the layers panel.
episodes.title: Working with Multiple Paths

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily demonstrate how to use different tools to draw paths.  They review the pencil, brush, blob brush, and smooth tool as well as discuss different options associated with each tool.
episodes.title: Freehand Drawing

episodes.description: Emily and Vonne continue with drawing tools, specifically covering how to create a new path versus continue a path and the fine nuances of the pencil and brush tools.
episodes.title: Freehand Drawing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily demonstrate and explain the importance of artboards.  They show how to use the artboard tool and the artboard panel to create new artboards and  how to modify options such as resizing, renaming, rearranging the order.
episodes.title: Artboards

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily demonstrate a variety of different tools, panels, and techniques for modifying objects.  They cover the eyedropper tool, transform panel and tool, create rounded corners with the selection tool and transform panel,  and scale stroke and effects options.
episodes.title: Object Transformation

episodes.description: A picture says a thousand words.  In this episode, Vonne and Emily show how to add an image to an Illustrator file.  They review the difference between linked and embedded images as well as how raster images behave in a vector file format.
episodes.title: Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily show how different ways to create a gradient using the gradient panel and gradient tool. They also demonstrate how to save gradient swatches, use gradients from the swatch libraries, and how to apply gradients on strokes.
episodes.title: Gradients

episodes.description: Emily and Vonne demonstrate different text effects, covering the type on a path tool , touch  type tool, and create outlines from text.
episodes.title: Text Effects

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily show how to combine shapes in different ways using the pathfinder panel. They define and demonstrate what is a compound path and how to work with them.
episodes.title: Pathfinder and Compound Path

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily introduce the basics of editing paths using the direct selection tool.  They define and introduce Bezier paths, covering the how to add, subtract, and convert points using the different pen tools.
episodes.title: Path Editing Tools

episodes.description: The pen tool is one of the most important tools in Illustrator. In this episode, Emily and Vonne demonstrate how to master the pen tool to create straight and curved paths.
episodes.title: The Pen Tool

episodes.description: Emily and Vonne show how to use the curvature tool - the cousin to the pen tool.
episodes.title: The Curvature Tool

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily introduce different ways to align objects using the align panel, grids and guides, and smart guides.
episodes.title: Aligning Objects

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily continue with aligning objects, specifically covering make guides from a selection, snap to grid and point, view grids, the measure tool, and outline view.
episodes.title: Aligning Objects Part 2

episodes.description: Emily and Vonne add some pizazz to objects by using effects.  They discuss the difference between Photoshop and Illustrator effects in the effects menu as well as 3D effects. They also cover the appearance panel, showing how to edit, add, remove, and rearrange effects  and formatting on fills and strokes of objects
episodes.title: Working with Effects

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily show how to work with the graphic styles panel.  They demonstrate how to find styles in the libraries, break link to style to create custom styles, and create your own graphic style.
episodes.title: Graphic Styles

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily demonstrate how to work with clipping masks and opacity masks in Illustrator to create different effects on objects.
episodes.title: Working with Masks

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily demonstrate how to use the mesh tool to create realistic shading.  They also cover the recolor artwork command and make a new color group of solid color swatches from a gradient.
episodes.title: Mesh and Recolor

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily take a deeper dive into swatches, specifically covering process versus spot swatches and global swatches. They explain best practices for using these types of swatches for commercial print and formatting artwork in general.
episodes.title: Advanced Swatches

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily discuss how to use and create pattern swatches.  They demonstrate how to create custom pattern swatches, edit existing pattern swatches, find pattern swatches in the swatch libraries, scaling swatches, and modify pattern to repeat on all sides.
episodes.title: Pattern Swatches

episodes.description: Sharing is caring.  In this episode, Vonne and Emily discuss how to share swatches using the Creative Cloud libraries panel.  They also show other ways to share swatches, brushes, styles, and symbols across documents using user defined libraries.
episodes.title: Sharing Swatches

episodes.description: In this episode, Emily and Vonne demonstrate how to blend paths using the blend command.  They show how to use the blend tool, modify objects and paths in the blend, explore the blend options, and expand into individual paths.
episodes.title: Blend Tool

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily explore how to use symbols, create symbols, edit symbols, symbol libraries, the symbol sprayer tools, and 9 slice scaling with symbols.
episodes.title: Symbols

episodes.description: Emily and Vonne take a deeper look into character and paragraph formatting.  They cover kerning, tracking, leading, indents, space before and after, character and paragraph styles, and other typography elements.  They also cover more about area type with how to control overset text, thread text boxes, and create columns.
episodes.title: Advanced Text

episodes.description: Creating bullets in Illustrator is not as easy as clicking a button.  In this episode, Vonne and Emily demonstrate how to create bullets using glyphs, indents, and tabs
episodes.title: Bullets and Numbering

episodes.description: In this episode, Emily and Vonne show how to use some lesser known tools for editing paths, specifically the eraser, knife, and scissors tool. They explain best practices for when and how to use these tools and some other techniques to manipulate closed and open paths.
episodes.title: Knife Eraser Sissors

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily continue to demonstrate the many ways to create paths in Illustrator. In this episode, they explore the shaper and the shape builder tool along with their associated tool options.
episodes.title: Shaper and Shape Builder

episodes.description: In this episode, Emily and Vonne transform paths with the offset path command, the width tool, outline stroke, and envelope distort.
episodes.title: Path Transformations

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily continue to transform paths, specifically covering the transform command and how to repeat commands as well as fun ways to use the rotate tool.
episodes.title: Path Transformations Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily show how to create vector paths from an image using image trace. They explore the image trace options using the panel and when and why to expand tracing.  They also demonstrate how to create a live paint group and use the live paint tool easily color artwork.
episodes.title: Image Trace and Live Paint

episodes.description: Vonne and Emily explore drawing and creating paths in perspective using the perspective grid tool. They show how to edit grids, choose planes to add paths, and use the perspective grid selection tool.
episodes.title: Perpective Grid

episodes.description: In this final episode of the series, Vonne and Emily show how to complete a project with save and export options.  They show new and old ways to export files to different raster file types for both print and web.  They explore working with web files with the asset export panel, align to pixel grid, and export for screen.
episodes.title: Saving and Exporting
